member.name: M:JigLibX.Utils.Array2D.Resize(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows resizing. Data will be lost if resizing occurred

member.name: M:JigLibX.Utils.Array2D.Pow(System.Single)
member.summary: Raise array elements to a power

member.name: M:JigLibX.Utils.Array2D.Abs
member.summary: Sets each value to its absolute value by comparison with float(0)

member.name: M:JigLibX.Utils.Array2D.GaussianFilter(System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Apply a Gaussian filter with length scale r, extending over a square of half-width n (so n=1 uses a square of 9 points, n = 2 uses 25 etc). Suggest using n at least 2*r.
member.param: length scale
half-width

member.name: M:JigLibX.Utils.Array2D.GetAt(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checked access - unwraps if wrapping set

member.name: M:JigLibX.Utils.Array2D.SetAt(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Checked access - unwraps if wrapping set

member.name: P:JigLibX.Utils.Array2D.Nx
member.summary: Gets the 'x' size of the array

member.name: P:JigLibX.Utils.Array2D.Nz
member.summary: Gets the 'y' size of the array

member.name: T:JigLibX.Physics.ConstraintMaxDistance
member.summary: Constraints a point on one body to be fixed to a point on another body

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Constraint.PreApply(System.Single)
member.summary: Prepare for applying constraints - the subsequent calls to apply will all occur with a constant position i.e. precalculate everything possible

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Constraint.Apply(System.Single)
member.summary: Apply the constraint by adding impulses. Return value indicates if any impulses were applied. If impulses were applied the derived class should call SetConstraintsUnsatisfied() on each body that is involved.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Constraint.Destroy
member.summary: Implementation should remove all references to bodies etc - they've been destroyed.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Constraint.SmoothCD(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,System.Single,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3,System.Single)
member.summary: SmoothCD for ease-in / ease-out smoothing Based on Game Programming Gems 4 Chapter 1.10
member.param: in/out: value to be smoothed
in/out: rate of change of the value
in: time interval
in: the target value
in: timescale for smoothing

member.name: P:JigLibX.Physics.Constraint.IsConstraintEnabled
member.summary: Are we registered with the physics system?

member.name: P:JigLibX.Physics.Constraint.Satisfied
member.summary: Derived class should call this when Apply has been called on this constraint.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.ConstraintMaxDistance.Destroy
member.summary: Destroy - sets body0 and body1 to null; calls DisableConstraint()

member.name: T:JigLibX.Collision.DetectFunctor
member.summary: Used during setup - allow the creator to register functors to do the actual collision detection. Each functor inherits from this - has a name to help debugging! The functor has to be able to handle the primitivs being passed to it in either order.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Collision.CollDetectBoxBox.Disjoint(System.Single@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,JigLibX.Geometry.Box,JigLibX.Geometry.Box,System.Single)
member.summary: Disjoint Returns true if disjoint. Returns false if intersecting, and sets the overlap depth, d scaled by the axis length.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Collision.CollDetectBoxBox.AddPoint(System.Collections.Generic.List{JigLibX.Collision.CollDetectBoxBox.ContactPoint},Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,System.Single)
member.summary: AddPoint if pt is less than Sqrt(combinationDistanceSq) from one of the others the original is replaced with the mean of it and pt, and false is returned. true means that pt was added to pts
The AABox has a corner at the origin and size sides.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Collision.CollDetectBoxBox.GetAABox2BoxEdgesIntersectionPoints(System.Collections.Generic.List{JigLibX.Collision.CollDetectBoxBox.ContactPoint},Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,JigLibX.Geometry.Box,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,System.Single)
member.summary: Pushes intersection points (in world space) onto the back of pts. Intersection is between an AABox faces and an orientated box's edges. orient and pos are used to transform the points from the AABox frame back into the original frame.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Collision.CollDetectBoxBox.GetBoxBoxIntersectionPoints(System.Collections.Generic.List{JigLibX.Collision.CollDetectBoxBox.ContactPoint},JigLibX.Geometry.Box,JigLibX.Geometry.Box,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Pushes intersection points onto the back of pts. Returns the number of points found. Points that are close together (compared to combinationDistance) get combined dirToBody0 is the collision normal towards box0

members.member:
All geometry primitives should derive from this so that it's possible to cast them into the correct type without the overhead/hassle of RTTI or virtual fns specific to just one class of primitive. Just do a static cast based on the type, or use the Get functions
However, destruction requires virtual functions really, as does supporting other user-defined primitives

member.name: M:JigLibX.Geometry.Primitive.SegmentIntersect(System.Single@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,JigLibX.Geometry.Segment)
member.summary: Must support intersection with a segment (ray cast)

member.name: M:JigLibX.Geometry.Primitive.GetSurfaceArea
member.summary: Calculate and return the surface area

member.name: M:JigLibX.Geometry.Primitive.GetMassProperties(JigLibX.Geometry.PrimitiveProperties,System.Single@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix@)
member.summary: Returns the mass, center of mass, and intertia tensor around the origin

member.name: M:JigLibX.Geometry.Primitive.GetBoundingBox(JigLibX.Geometry.AABox@)
member.summary: Returns a bounding box that covers this primitive. Default returns a huge box, so implement this in the derived class for efficiency

member.name: M:JigLibX.Geometry.Primitive.GetBoundingBox
member.summary: Returns a bounding box that covers this primitive. Default returns a huge box, so implement this in the derived class for efficiency

member.summary: Gets Transform or Sets transformMatrix and invTransform

member.summary: Use a cached version as this occurs ALOT during triangle mesh traversal

member.name: P:JigLibX.Geometry.TriangleMesh.InverseTransformMatrix
member.summary: Use a cached version as this occurs ALOT during triangle mesh traversal

member.summary: Indicates if a segment intersects a triangle

member.summary: Indicates if a segment overlaps an AABox

member.name: T:JigLibX.Geometry.IndexedTriangle
member.summary: Support for an indexed triangle - assumes ownership by something that has an array of vertices and an array of tIndexedTriangle

members.member: indices into our owner's array of vertices

member.name: M:JigLibX.Geometry.IndexedTriangle.SetVertexIndices(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3})
member.summary: Set the indices into the relevant vertex array for this triangle. Also sets the plane and bounding box

member.summary: Set the indices into the relevant vertex array for this triangle. Also sets the plane and bounding box

member.name: M:JigLibX.Geometry.IndexedTriangle.GetVertexIndices(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Get the indices into the relevant vertex array for this triangle.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Geometry.IndexedTriangle.GetVertexIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the vertex index association with iCorner (which should be 0, 1, or 2)

member.name: M:JigLibX.Geometry.IndexedTriangle.IsEdgeConvex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Has the edge been marked as convex. Same convention for edge numbering as in tTriangle

member.name: M:JigLibX.Geometry.IndexedTriangle.IsPointConvex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Has the point been marked as convex. Samve convention for point numbering as in tTriangle

member.name: T:JigLibX.Geometry.TriangleVertexIndices
member.summary: Structure used to set up the mesh

member.name: T:JigLibX.Physics.Body
member.summary: Basic rigid body - can be used as is, or a derived class can over-ride certain behaviours. A body can only be added to one physics system at a time!

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Body.PostPhysics(System.Single)
member.summary: Called right at the end of the timestep to notify the derived classes.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Body.PrePhysics(System.Single)
member.summary: Called right at the beginning of the timestep to notify the derived classes.
member.param: The delta time.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Body.MoveTo(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix)
member.summary: This sets the position (sets the vel to 0), but it also tries to make sure that any frozen bodies resting against this one get activated if necessary. Not very efficient. Be a little careful about when you call it - it will mess with the physics collision list. Also, after this call the object will be active.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Body.UpdateVelocity(System.Single)
member.summary: Implementation updates the velocity/angular rotation with the force/torque.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Body.UpdatePosition(System.Single)
member.summary: Implementation updates the position/orientation with the current velocties.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Body.UpdatePositionWithAux(System.Single)
member.summary: Updates the position with the auxilary velocities, and zeros them.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Body.InternalSetImmovable
member.summary: Used by physics to temporarily make an object immovable - needs to restore afterwards!

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Body.InternalRestoreImmovable
member.summary: Used by physics to temporarily make an object immovable - needs to restore afterwars!

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Body.GetShouldBeActive
member.summary: Indicates if the velocity is above the threshold for freezing

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Body.DampForDeactivation
member.summary: Damp movement as the body approaches deactivation

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Body.SetDeactivationTime(System.Single)
member.summary: Set how long it takes to deactivate.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Body.SetActivityThreshold(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Set what the velocity threshold is for activation. rot is in deg per second.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Body.GetVelocity(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3)
member.summary: Returns the velocity of a point at body-relative position (in world frame) relPos

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Body.GetVelocity(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@)
member.summary: Returns the velocity of a point at body-relative position (in world frame) relPos

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Body.GetVelocityAux(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3)
member.summary: As GetVelocity but just uses the aux velocities

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Body.GetVelocityAux(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@)
member.summary: As GetVelocity but just uses the aux velocities

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Body.AddMovementActivation(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3,JigLibX.Physics.Body)
member.summary: Adds the other body to the list of bodies to be activated if this body moves more than a certain distance from either a previously stored position, or the position passed in.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Body.ClearForces
member.summary: This just sets all forces/impulses etc to zero

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Body.AddGravityToExternalForce
member.summary: Adds the force of global gravity to the external force, if the body is marked to be effected via global gravity

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Body.AddExternalForces(System.Single)
member.summary: Allow the body to add on any additional forces (including gravity)/impulses etc. Default behaviour sets to gravity.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Body.CopyCurrentStateToOld
member.summary: Copies the current position etc to old - normally called only by tPhysicsSystem.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Body.StoreState
member.summary: Copy our current state (position, velocity etc) into the stored state

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Body.RestoreState
member.summary: Restore from the stored state into our current state.

member.name: P:JigLibX.Physics.Body.IsBodyEnabled
member.summary: Are we registered with the physics system?

member.name: P:JigLibX.Physics.Body.CollisionSkin
member.summary: Allowed to return null if this body doesn't engage in collisions.

member.name: P:JigLibX.Physics.Body.Immovable
member.summary: Ensures that this object never moves, and reduces collision checking.

member.name: P:JigLibX.Physics.Body.AllowFreezing
member.summary: Allows getting/setting of whether this body ever freezes

member.name: P:JigLibX.Physics.Body.DoShockProcessing
member.summary: Bodies that use a lot of constraints don't behave very well during the physics shock step, so they can bypass it.

member.name: T:JigLibX.Collision.CollDetectInfo
member.summary: Details about which parts of the skins are colliding.

member.name: F:JigLibX.Collision.SmallCollPointInfo.InitialPenetration
member.summary: Estimated Penetration before the objects collide (can be -ve)

member.name: F:JigLibX.Collision.SmallCollPointInfo.R0
member.summary: Positions relative to body 0 (in world space)

member.name: F:JigLibX.Collision.SmallCollPointInfo.R1
member.summary: positions relative to body 1 (if there is a body1)

member.name: F:JigLibX.Collision.CollPointInfo.MinSeparationVel
member.summary: Used by physics to cache desired minimum separation velocity in the normal direction

member.name: F:JigLibX.Collision.CollPointInfo.Denominator
member.summary: Used by physics to cache value used in calculating impulse

member.name: F:JigLibX.Collision.CollPointInfo.AccumulatedNormalImpulse
member.summary: Used by physics to accumulated the normal impulse

member.name: F:JigLibX.Collision.CollPointInfo.AccumulatedFrictionImpulse
member.summary: Used by physics to accumulated the normal impulse

member.name: F:JigLibX.Collision.CollPointInfo.AccumulatedNormalImpulseAux
member.summary: Used by physics to accumulated the normal impulse

member.name: F:JigLibX.Collision.CollPointInfo.Position
member.summary: Used by physics to cache the world position (not really needed? pretty useful in debugging!)

member.name: T:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionInfo
member.summary: Contains all the details about a collision between two skins, each of which may be associated with a tBody. Each collision can have a number of points associated with it

member.name: M:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionInfo.Destroy
member.summary: Destroy - sets SkinInfo.Skin0(1) to null. Calls freePtInfos.Push(...) on PointInfo[i]

member.name: M:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionInfo.GetCollisionInfo(JigLibX.Collision.CollDetectInfo,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3,JigLibX.Collision.SmallCollPointInfo[],System.Int32)
member.summary: CollisionInfos will be given out from a pool. If more than MaxCollisionPoints are passed in, the input positions will be silently truncated!

member.name: M:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionInfo.FreeCollisionInfo(JigLibX.Collision.CollisionInfo)
member.summary: Return this info to the pool.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Geometry.Octree.CreateAABox(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.BoundingBox,JigLibX.Geometry.Octree.EChild)
member.summary: Create a bounding box appropriate for a child, based on a parents AABox

member.name: T:JigLibX.Geometry.Octree.EChild
member.summary: Endices into the children - P means "plus" and M means "minus" and the letters are xyz. So PPM means +ve x, +ve y, -ve z

member.name: T:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSystemBrute
member.summary: CollisionSystem which checks every skin against each other. For small scenes this is as fast or even faster as CollisionSystemGrid.

member.name: T:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSystem
member.summary: Interface to a class that will contain a list of all the collision objects in the world, and it will provide ways of detecting collisions between other objects and these collision objects.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSystem.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor initialized the default CollisionFunctors. Other CollisionFunctors can be added with RegisterCollDetectFunctor.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSystem.AddCollisionSkin(JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSkin)
member.summary: Don't add skins whilst doing detection!

member.name: M:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSystem.RemoveCollisionSkin(JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSkin)
member.summary: Don't remove skins whilst doing detection!

member.name: M:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSystem.CollisionSkinMoved(JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSkin)
member.summary: Whenever a skin changes position it will call this to let us update our internal state.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSystem.DetectCollisions(JigLibX.Physics.Body,JigLibX.Collision.CollisionFunctor,JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSkinPredicate2,System.Single)
member.summary: Detects all collisions between the body and all the registered collision skins (which should have already had their positions/bounding volumes etc updated). For each potential pair of skins then the predicate (if it exists) will be called to see whether or not to continue. If the skins are closer than collTolerance (+ve value means report objects that aren't quite colliding) then the functor will get called. You can't just loop over all your bodies calling this, because that will double-detect collisions. Use DetectAllCollisions for that.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSystem.DetectAllCollisions(System.Collections.Generic.List{JigLibX.Physics.Body},JigLibX.Collision.CollisionFunctor,JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSkinPredicate2,System.Single)
member.summary: As DetectCollisions but detects for all bodies, testing each pair only once

member.name: M:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSystem.RegisterCollDetectFunctor(JigLibX.Collision.DetectFunctor)
member.summary: type0/1 could be from tCollisionSkinType or they could be larger values. The collision detection table will get extended as necessary. You only need to register the function once (i.e. not for type0, type1 then type1, type 0).

member.name: M:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSystem.GetCollDetectFunctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the previously registered function for the pair type. May return 0.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSystem.SegmentIntersect(System.Single@,JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSkin@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,JigLibX.Geometry.Segment,JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSkinPredicate1)
member.summary: Intersect a segment with the world. If non-zero the predicate allows certain skins to be excluded

member.name: P:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSystem.UseSweepTests
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether collision tests should use sweep or overlap

member.name: P:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSystem.MaterialTable
member.summary: Gets the current MaterialTable of the CollisionSystem.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSystemBrute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new CollisionSystem which checks for collision by checking each skin against each other.

member.name: T:JigLibX.Vehicles.Chassis
member.summary: Basic rigid body to represent a single chassis - at the moment no moving components. You can inherit from this and pass your own version to Car (TODO - tidy up this)

member.name: M:JigLibX.Vehicles.Chassis.SetDims(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3)
member.summary: Set the dimensions of the chassis, specified by the extreme corner points. This will also call Car.SetupDefaultWheels();

member.name: M:JigLibX.Vehicles.Chassis.GetDims(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@)
member.summary: Set the dimensions of the chassis, specified by the extreme corner points. This will also call Car.SetupDefaultWheels();

member.name: T:JigLibX.Vehicles.ChassisBody
member.summary: Extend tBody to allow for adding on car-specific forces (e.g. wheel/drive forces) - i.e. when we get asked to add on forces give the car the opportunity to do stuff

member.name: T:JigLibX.Physics.HingeJoint
member.summary: Implements a simple hinge between two rigid bodies. The bodies should be in a suitable configuration when this joint is created.

member.name: T:JigLibX.Physics.Joint
member.summary: Virtual base class for all joints All joints are expected to do the following in their constructor: 1. create whatever constraints are necessary 2. register these constraints with the physics engine

member.name: T:JigLibX.Physics.Controller
member.summary: This can get updated at the same time as Body.AddExternalForces so that forces can be added independant of individual bodies - e.g. joints between pairs of bodies.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.Controller.UpdateController(System.Single)
member.summary: Implement this to apply whatever forces are needed to the objects this controls

member.name: P:JigLibX.Physics.Controller.IsControllerEnabled
member.summary: Are we registered with the physics system?

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.HingeJoint.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor so you can initialise this joint later

member.name: T:JigLibX.Geometry.Heightmap
member.summary: Defines a heightmap that has up in the "Y" direction
member.remarks: Indicies go from "bottom right" - i.e. (0, 0) -> (xmin, ymin) heights/normals are obtained by interpolation over triangles, with each quad being divided up in the same way - the diagonal going from (i, j) to (i+1, j+1)

member.name: M:JigLibX.Geometry.Heightmap.#ctor(JigLibX.Utils.Array2D,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Pass in an array of heights, and the axis that represents up Also the centre of the heightmap (assuming z is up), and the grid size

member.name: M:JigLibX.Geometry.Heightmap.RecalculateBoundingBox
member.summary: Call this after changing heights. So the bounding box for collision detection gets recalculated.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Geometry.Heightmap.GetHeight(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the height at a particular index, indices are clamped

member.name: M:JigLibX.Geometry.Heightmap.GetHeightAndNormal(System.Single@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get height and normal (quicker than calling both)

member.name: T:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionFunctor
member.summary: The user of CollisionSystem creates an object derived from CollisionFunctor and passes it in to DetectCollisions. For every collision detected the functor gets called so that the user can decide if they want to keep the collision.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionFunctor.CollisionNotify(JigLibX.Collision.CollDetectInfo@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,JigLibX.Collision.SmallCollPointInfo[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Skins are passed back because there maybe more than one skin per body, and the user can always get the body from the skin.

member.name: T:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSkinPredicate2
member.summary: The user can create an object derived from this and pass it in to CollisionSystem.DetectCollisions to indicate whether a pair of skins should be considered.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSkinPredicate2.ConsiderSkinPair(JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSkin,JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSkin)
member.summary: Decides whether a pair of skins should be considered for collision or not.
member.returns: True if the pair should be considered otherwise false.

member.name: T:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSkinPredicate1
member.summary: The user can create an object derived from this and pass it in to the ray/segment intersection functions to indicate whether certain skins should be considered.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSkinPredicate1.ConsiderSkin(JigLibX.Collision.CollisionSkin)
member.summary: Decides whether a CollisionSkin should be considered while doing SegmentIntersecting tests or not.
member.param: Skin to be considered.
member.returns: True if the skin should be considered otherwise false.

member.name: T:JigLibX.Collision.CollisionCallbackFn
member.summary: A skin can ask to get a callback when a collision is detected this will be called if it return false, the contact points will not be generated
member.param: The skin that had the callback on
The other skin that we have collided with (maybe null tho would be odd...)
member.returns: False to inhibit contact point generation

member.name: P:JigLibX.Geometry.Plane.Transform
member.summary: Gets Transform or Sets transformMatrix and invTransform

member.name: P:JigLibX.Geometry.Plane.TransformMatrix
member.summary: Use a cached version. Gets transformMatrix

member.name: P:JigLibX.Geometry.Plane.InverseTransformMatrix
member.summary: Use a cached version. Gets invTransform

member.summary: Returns the distance of two segments.

First segment to test.
Second segment to test.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Geometry.AABox.#ctor(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3)
member.summary: Position based on one corner. sideLengths are the full side lengths (each element must be >= 0)

member.summary: Adds a point to the AABB.
member.remarks: This function is heavily used to calculate the axis aligned bounding boxes arround any object. Calling by reference is unusal but makes it faster.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Geometry.AABox.AddPoint(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3)
member.summary: Adds a point to the AABB

member.name: M:JigLibX.Geometry.AABox.SegmentIntersect(System.Single@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,JigLibX.Geometry.Segment)

member.name: P:JigLibX.Geometry.AABox.Transform
member.summary: Gets new Transform or Sets offset to value.Position

member.remarks: Note: Not thread safe or re-entrant as it uses pts

member.name: T:JigLibX.Collision.MaterialTable
member.summary: This handles the properties of interactions between different materials.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Collision.MaterialTable.#ctor
member.summary: On construction all the default Materials get added

member.name: M:JigLibX.Collision.MaterialTable.Reset
member.summary: Clear everything except the default Materials

member.name: M:JigLibX.Collision.MaterialTable.SetMaterialProperties(System.Int32,JigLibX.Collision.MaterialProperties)

member.name: T:JigLibX.Physics.PhysicsSystem
member.summary: Looks after (but doesn't own) a collection of bodies and runs their updates. Doesn't deal with collision detection - it will get passes a collision detector to do that. In the vast majority of cases there will be only one physics system, and it is consequently very annoying if every object has to keep track of which physics system it's associated with. Therefore, PhysicsSystem supports a "singleton" style use, but it also lets the user change the "current" physics system (bad things will happen if you set it to zero whilst there are still physical objects!). If you want more than one physics system, then in your update loop set the physics system to the first one, run physics, then set it to the second one etc. Note that the physics system constructor and destructor will set the current physics system variable, so under normal circumstances you don't need to worry about this.

member.name: M:JigLibX.Physics.PhysicsSystem.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new PhysicSystem and makes it the current one.
